member.name: T:Ranorex.Core.DefaultActionAttribute
member.summary: Specifies the default action of an adapter.
member.remarks: By applying this attribute to a method in an adapter you can specify the default action of that adapter. This attribute must only be applied to a single method in an adapter!

member.name: T:Ranorex.Core.ActionDescriptor
member.summary: A descriptor for actions which are essentially methods.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.ActionDescriptor.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Ranorex.Core.ActionDescriptor.Argument,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Ranorex.Core.ActionDescriptor.Argument})
member.summary: Creates a new action descriptor.
member.param: The name of the action. Should be CamelCased.
A short description of the action, its parameters and what is supposed to do.
The return value of the action. If nothing is returned, pass null here.
A list of key-value pairs describing the arguments for the action.

member.name: P:Ranorex.Core.ActionDescriptor.Returns
member.summary: Gets the return value of this action. If this action does not return a value, the value is null.

member.name: P:Ranorex.Core.ActionDescriptor.Arguments
member.summary: Gets a list of key-value pairs describing the arguments of the action.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.ActionDescriptor.CompareTo(Ranorex.Core.Descriptor)
member.summary: Compares the current descriptor with another descriptor.
member.param: A descriptor to compare with this descriptor.
member.returns:
A 32-bit signed integer that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has the following meanings:
ValueMeaning
Less than zeroThis object is less than the parameter.
ZeroThis object is equal to .
Greater than zeroThis object is greater than .

member.name: P:Ranorex.Core.Configuration.PluginsConfig.Win32Config.EnableBitBridge
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable the 32/64 bit bridge.
member.value: true if the 32/64 bit bridge should be enabled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Some functionality of the Win32 plugin is limited if a 32 bit process automates a 64 bit application (and vice versa). If the 32/64 bit bridge is enabled, the communication will transparently use a proxy process that has the same bit width as the automated application to provide the full functionality of the Win32 plugin.

member.name: T:Ranorex.Core.ScreenLocation
member.summary: Needed to abstract the calculation of the actual screen coordinates from a location object in mouse and touch move operations.
member.remarks: E.g. locations involving image operations should only be evaluated once as the actual screenshot of an element could change when the mouse moves over it. For element locations, mouse/touch move operations may evaluate the screen position more than once to adapt for moving elements.

member.name: T:Ranorex.Core.Distance
member.summary: Represents an proportional or fixed distance in pixels.
member.remarks: A fixed distance specifies the distance in pixels. The proportional distance is specified as the percentage of an elements width or height. Proportional distances are only useful when they are used in conjunction with an to calculate the fixed distance based on some element rectangle.

member.exception: If the location is not a fixed location.

member.exception: If the location is not a proportional location.

member.summary: Returns a string representation of the distance.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.Distance.CalculateFixedDistance(System.Drawing.Rectangle,Ranorex.Core.Recorder.Touch.GestureDirection)
member.summary: Calculates the fixed distance for the specified element rectangle and the given angle.
member.remarks: If the distance is already a fixed distance, simply the fixed distance value will be returned. The given element rectangle and the gesture angle will not affect the distance. These will only affect the distance, if the distance is a proportional distance. The function will determine by the given angle if the width or the height of the element rectangle will be used to calculate the distance. The height will be used if 225 < angle <= 315 or 45 < angle <= 135; otherwise the width will be used.
member.param: The pixel based rectangle to calculate the fixed distance for.
The angle that determines if width or height will be used for the calculation.
member.returns: The fixed distance in pixels (rounded).

If the given string is a negative number.

member.returns: When this method returns, 'd' contains the distance equivalent if the conversion succeeded, or Distance(0) if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if parameter 's' is null, , it has a invalid format or the given string represents a negative number.
member.exception: If the given string is null.
If the given string is not a numeric type (int or double).
If the given string is a negative number.

member.name: T:Ranorex.Core.Recorder.Touch.GestureDirection
member.summary: DataStucture to define a direction for gesture record items. The direction is defined clockwise starting with 0° which corresponds to the direction right.

member.name: F:Ranorex.Core.Recorder.Touch.GestureDirection.Up
member.summary: Static readonly direction defining the'Up' direction (270°).

member.name: F:Ranorex.Core.Recorder.Touch.GestureDirection.Right
member.summary: Static readonly direction defining the 'Right' direction (0°).

member.name: F:Ranorex.Core.Recorder.Touch.GestureDirection.Down
member.summary: Static readonly direction defining the 'Down' direction (90°).

member.name: F:Ranorex.Core.Recorder.Touch.GestureDirection.Left
member.summary: Static readonly direction defining the 'Left' direction (180°).

member.name: F:Ranorex.Core.Recorder.Touch.GestureDirection.Angle
member.summary: The angle of the direction in degrees. 0° is equal to the direction 'Right'. Direction is clockwise.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.Recorder.Touch.GestureDirection.#ctor(System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new direction with the given angle. The angle can have values bigger than 360.0 and smaller than 0.0.
member.param: The angle of the direction in degrees.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.Recorder.Touch.GestureDirection.ToString
member.summary: Returns the string representation of the direction. For the four main directions the string representation will be: 'Right (0°)', 'Down (90°), 'Left (180°)' and 'Up (270°)'. For every other angle the representation will be 'Angle°' with at most one decimal place if a decimal place is required.
member.returns: The string representation of the direction.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.Recorder.Touch.GestureDirection.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a angle data structure from a given string. Parsing is performed case insensitive.
member.param: The string representing the direction. Valid representations e.g. are '90', '90.0', '90.0°', 'Right 0', 'Right (0)', 'Right(0)' and 'Right (0°)'. The number in the string weights more than the direction specification. That means if the value 'Right (90.0)' is passed to the method, the direction will not be parsed as 'Right (90°)' instead it will be parsed as 'Down (90°)'.
member.returns: GestureDirection instance with the parsed value.
member.exception: If value is null.
If value was empty or contained whitespace only.
If the value could not be parsed.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.Recorder.Touch.GestureDirection.op_Implicit(Ranorex.Core.Recorder.Touch.GestureDirection)~System.Double
member.summary: Implicit conversion operator from direction to double.
member.param: The direction data structure that will get converted.
member.returns: A double corresponding to the 'Angle' field of the direction data structure.

member.name: T:Ranorex.Core.Remoting.Data.IosDeviceInfo
member.summary: DataStucture that holds all iOS device infos. If no infos could be fetched (e.g. when the RxDeviceInfos library is not linked to the application under test) from the device, the corresponding property will be set to a default value. The default value for bool properties is false. The default value for string is null. The default value for numeric types is -1. Please note that he iOS simulator will deliver values for device infos but their values will be based on hardware specifications of the simulator host system. For more information how the get valid device infos from an iOS device or simulator see.
member.remarks: Note that the information that can be retrieved can vary depending on device and iOS version.

member.name: P:Ranorex.Core.Remoting.RecordItems.InstrumentApkOptions.EnableWebTesting
member.summary: When set to true Ranorex shows DOM content of WebViews in UI-Hierarchy. Note that this feature has a huge performance impact on your app. (See: http://www.ranorex.com/support/user-guide-20/android-testing/testing-of-mobile-websites-on-android.html). Default is true.

member.name: P:Ranorex.Core.Remoting.RecordItems.InstrumentApkOptions.TreeSimplification
member.summary: When set to false no post processing of the UI-Tree takes place. This results in a larger UI-Tree which could be useful for automating 3rd party Android controls. (See: http://www.ranorex.com/support/user-guide-20/android-testing.html#TreeSimplification). Default is true.

member.name: P:Ranorex.Core.Remoting.RecordItems.InstrumentApkOptions.FullImageComparison
member.summary: When set to true more robust image comparison is used to determine resource id's for images. This option decreases startup performance. (See: http://www.ranorex.com/support/user-guide-20/android-testing.html#FullImageComparison). Default is false.

member.name: T:Ranorex.Core.Remoting.IRemoteElement
member.summary: Represents a remote UI-Element. Remote UI-Elements are such elements that are not residing on localhost. Instead they are elements of applications running on a device computer that is connected to the ranorex System by a network channel.
member.remarks: Primarily this interface is used within the class to check if an element is a remote element. If so, the Mouse and Key sequences are not handled by the 'global' Mouse and Keyboard handler class, instead it is forwarded to the element itself, so that it can handle it (in general handling within an element means sending data over the network so that the remote device/machine performs the required actions). Additionally the class will check if an element is an IRemoteElement. If so it will call CaptureScreenshot() to retrieve the screenshot from the element instead of taking a screenshot from the local desktop.

member.name: T:Ranorex.Core.Remoting.IRemoteEndpoint
member.summary: Represents an interface for connection endpoints to remote devices. Use to retrieve concrete implementations of an IRemoteEndpoint.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.Remoting.IRemoteEndpoint.EnableEventSynchronization(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Event synchronization is primarily used in recorder mode. Enabling event synchronization signals the implementation of an IRemoteDevice that we are operating in recording mode, where it is required that the UI doesn't change until an event that was received from the remote device is processed by the Ranorex system. Because otherwise often the UI already would change before the event was processed. This can lead to a behavior where the UI-Element cannot be identified by the element engine while the event is processed because a complete new UI-Tree is already loaded and this button doesn't exist anymore.
member.param: Set to true to enable event synchronization. Should only be done while in recording mode where recording events get processed by Ranorex

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.Remoting.IRemoteEndpoint.DisconnectAndDisable
member.summary: Disconnects the device from the Ranorex System and marks it disabled in the devices list, so that it won't get connected automatically again.
member.remarks: The disconnect has also to take care, that the device is not found anymore by the element engine (Remove Item from the ranorex UI-Tree)

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.Remoting.IRemoteEndpoint.ReconnectAsync
member.summary: Disconnects the device temporarily. It will get connected automatically by the infrastructure on the next refresh event. The operation will be performed on a background thread.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.Remoting.IRemoteEndpoint.Reconnect
member.summary: Disconnects the device temporarily. It will get connected automatically by the infrastructure on the next refresh event.

member.name: T:Ranorex.Core.ISelfHighlight
member.summary: FlavorElements implementing this interface will be treated as elements that know how they can highlight them self and thereby will not be highlighted by Ranorex's standard highlight mechanism. This is primarily required for elements that do not reside on the machine the test runner is executed on because in such cases special handling (e.g. network commands) are required.

member.summary: Highlights the element for the specified amount of time. The implementation should be asynchronous.
member.param: Duration the element shall be highlighted in milliseconds. 0 means the implementation should use it's default duration.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.Element.TryFindInternal(Ranorex.Core.RxPath,Ranorex.Duration,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.IList{Ranorex.Core.Element}@,Ranorex.Libs.CacheSession@)
member.summary: Provides common functionality for Find and FindSingle with and without timeout
member.remarks: A returned exception (not equal to null) signals an argument exception or contains an if no element is found. is not null if the path was searched, and contains zero elements if no elements were found for the path. Consequently, the following implications are true when the method returns: returned exception == null => foundElements != null AND foundElement.Count > 0 foundElements == null => returned exception is argument exception foundElements != null => no argument exception, but foundElements may contain 0 elements foundElements != null AND foundElements.Count == 0 => returned exception is ElementNotFoundException

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.Element.FindChildFromPointByRectangle(System.Drawing.Point,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Find a child of this element by screen location, by searching the element tree for a best-fitting rectangle.
member.param: The location where the child is located.

If true, all children are searched and the first containing the specified point is returned; if false, it is assumed that the hierarchical element relationship is also reflected by the geometric structure of the corresponding elements. This way the best fitting element is returned.
Generally said, one should set this parameter to true if the hierarchical relationship between elements is not reflected by their geometric structure.
member.returns: The element found at the specified location.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.Element.FindChildOrSelfFromPointByRectangle(System.Drawing.Point,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Find a child of this element by screen location, or the element itself.
member.param: The location to search for.

If true, all children are searched and the first containing the specified point is returned; if false, it is assumed that the hierarchical element relationship is also reflected by the geometric structure of the corresponding elements. This way the best fitting element is returned.
Generally said, one should set this parameter to true if the hierarchical relationship between elements is not reflected by their geometric structure.
member.returns: The element at the specified location.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.ElementEngine.WaitForValidLicense
member.summary: Waits for valid license to become available.
member.remarks:
This method works both with floating and node-locked licenses being configured on the local machine. If no license is configured, this method will instantly return whether the evaluation period is still valid (the evaluation dialog will be displayed, when the property is first accessed).
No dialogs or error messages will be shown by this method.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.ElementEngine.WaitForValidLicense(Ranorex.Duration,Ranorex.Duration)
member.summary: Waits for valid license to become available.
member.param: The maximum time the method should wait for a license to become available.
The interval between individual checks for a valid license to become available.
member.returns: true if a valid license becomes available within the timeout; false otherwise.
member.remarks:
This method works both with floating and node-locked licenses being configured on the local machine. If no license is configured, this method will instantly return whether the evaluation period is still valid (the evaluation dialog will be displayed, when the property is first accessed).
No dialogs or error messages will be shown by this method.
member.exception: If is or is negative.

member.name: T:Ranorex.Core.FindRefineMode
member.summary: Mode for search postprocessing.

member.name: F:Ranorex.Core.FindRefineMode.None
member.summary: No additional search is needed.

member.name: F:Ranorex.Core.FindRefineMode.SearchHierarchy
member.summary: An additional search is needed and the assumption should be made that the hierarchical relationship of elements in the search is reflected by their geometric structure.

member.name: F:Ranorex.Core.FindRefineMode.SearchAll
member.summary: An additional search is needed and no assumption should be made regarding the relationship of the elements in the search and their geometric structure.

member.name: F:Ranorex.Core.FindRefineMode.ContinueForeignChildren
member.summary: Indicates that the found lineage/element is unusable and that the search should instead be continued on children of the current flavor element that have a foreign flavor.

member.name: F:Ranorex.Core.FindRefineMode.SearchForElement
member.summary: Specifies that the returned lineage at the specified point should be searched in the flavor subtree by using the method.

member.name: F:Ranorex.Core.UidFindResult.NotFound
member.summary: No element was found for the given unique id.

member.name: F:Ranorex.Core.UidFindResult.Failed
member.summary: The underlying flavor implementation was not able to find something by unique id because of an internal error.

member.name: F:Ranorex.Core.UidFindResult.NotSupported
member.summary: The underlying flavor does not support search by unique id. (Default)

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.FlavorElement.GetChildLineageFromUid(System.String,Ranorex.Core.UidFindResult@)
member.summary: Gets the child lineage from the current element to the element with the given unique id.
member.param: The uid value to search for.
The result status. This defaults to FindStatus.NotSupported if the flavor does not support unique id search.
member.returns: A lineage of elements or null if nothing was found or the method is not supported.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.FlavorElement.GetChildLineageFromPoint(System.Drawing.Point,Ranorex.Core.FindRefineMode@)
member.summary: Returns a list of flavor elements that is the lineage to the flavor element at the specified screen location.
member.returns: The lineage to the flavor element at the specified point as a list.
member.param: The screen location to search at.
Can be set to indicate that further searching is required.
member.remarks:
The first element in the returned list is the direct child of this flavor element, the k-th element is the parent of the (k+1)-th element, and the last element is the actual flavor element at the specified screen location. Consequently, an empty list is to be returned if this element is the best fitting element at the requested point.
Returns null if the specified is not within this or one of its descendant elements.

Value Meaning

member.name: T:Ranorex.Core.PathBuildMode
member.summary: The method how RxPaths are built.

member.name: F:Ranorex.Core.PathBuildMode.Default
member.summary: Uses the PathBuildMode specified in the current "RxPath.BuildMode" configuration.

member.name: F:Ranorex.Core.PathBuildMode.Volatile
member.summary: No optimization is performed. Path predicates contain valid, appropriate and existing attribute values or indexes if no attributes can be used. Path predicates include volatile attributes such as handle or processid.

member.name: F:Ranorex.Core.PathBuildMode.Simple
member.summary: No optimization is performed. Path predicates contain valid, appropriate and existing attribute values or indexes if no attributes can be used.

member.name: F:Ranorex.Core.PathBuildMode.Reduce
member.summary: Reduces the number of path predicates such that the path remains non-ambiguous. This usually shortens the path and makes it more robust by eliminating unnecessary attributes.

member.name: F:Ranorex.Core.PathBuildMode.StepCostReduce
member.summary: Reduces the number of path predicates such that the path remains non-ambiguous. In addition to that, removes intermediate steps considered as unimportant. Can be heavily tuned using the RxPath.PathBuildMode settings. This usually shortens the path and makes it more robust by eliminating unnecessary attributes.

member.name: F:Ranorex.Core.PathBuildMode.ReduceForRef
member.summary: Reduces the number of path predicates such that the path remains non-ambiguous. This usually shortens the path and makes it more robust by eliminating unnecessary attributes. Variant of 'Reduce' used for reference paths in repositories. Contains more information than 'Reduce'.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.IReportLogger.LogText(Ranorex.ReportLevel,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Logs a text message.
member.param: The message level.
The category name.
The message text.
Text escaping flag.
Advanced reference information for use in the report.
member.remarks: The class calls this method for each attached instance when the method is called. The logger should store the method arguments in the data store.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.IReportLogger.LogData(Ranorex.ReportLevel,System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Logs a data message.
member.param: The message level.
The category name.
An optional message string for the data.
The message data object (can also be a null reference).
Advanced reference information for use in the report.
member.remarks:
The class calls this method for each attached instance when the method is called. The logger should store the method arguments in the data store.
You should handle all the data types you will pass to the method in that method. By default, Ranorex uses this method to store screenshot and snapshot data in a report, so make sure that you handle data of type and . Additionally, the . method passes a object to that method that can be used to add a link to the report.

The object that represents the culture for which the resource is localized. member.summary: Restarts the current executable with UI access privileges. Those privileges are required to access Windows apps.
member.returns: The exit code returned by the current executable.

The specified file is in use. -or- There is an open handle on the file, and the operating system is Windows XP or earlier. This open handle can result from enumerating directories and files. For more information, see How to: Enumerate Directories and Files.

Wildcard character Description
* Zero or more characters.
? Exactly one character.
This method works similar to , but also allows ".." and "." in the path to relatively specify the current or parent folder, respectively.

member.name: T:Ranorex.Core.Watchdog
member.summary: Provides a way to abort a thread after a specified timeout.
member.remarks:
When the timeout is reached, the is aborted by calling on the thread. If you specify a state object in the constructor, that object is set to the of the that is raised when the is aborted due to the timeout being elapsed.
Note that an asynchronous abort of the watched thread is done not before 150% of the specified timeout are reached. Call the method from the watched thread to abort the watched thread synchronously when the timeout is reached, but before the asynchronous abort happens.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.Watchdog.#ctor(System.Object,Ranorex.Duration)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance.
member.param: Specifies the value of the property of the that is raised when the is aborted.
Specifies the timeout after which the is aborted.
member.remarks: The will be watched.

member.summary: Constructs a new instance.
member.param: Specifies the value of the property of the that is raised when the is aborted.
Specifies the timeout after which the is aborted.
The watched thread.

member.summary: When the instance is finalized, frees all resources of the instance.

member.name: P:Ranorex.Core.Watchdog.WatchedThread
member.summary: The that is watched and aborted if the timeout is elapsed.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.Watchdog.CheckAbortSynchronous
member.summary: Can be called by the watched thread (and the watched thread only) to force the watchdog to check the timeout and consequently abort synchronously.
member.exception: If this method is not executed by the .

member.name: M:Ranorex.Core.Watchdog.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources held by this instance.
member.remarks: Note: Disposing the instance before the timeout has expired won't abort the watched thread.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Adapter.PressKeys(System.String)
member.summary: Tries to set focus to the adapter and then presses the keys specified by .
member.param: A sequence of characters and escape groups that specify the keys to press.
member.remarks:
Each key is represented by a single character or an escape group. To specify a single keyboard character, use the character itself (e.g. use "aBc" to press the keys A, B+Shift, and C after another). Only the '{' character has a special meaning and needs to be escaped by preceding it with another '{' (specify "{{" to issue a '{' key press).
Escape groups, signaled by braces "{}", may be used to produce a key action with any of the keys specified by the enumeration. "{Z}" means that the 'z' key should be pressed, and "{return}" or "{enter}" that the Return key is to be pressed.
Additionally, in an escape group you can specify a modifier that determines whether the key should be hold down (e.g. {CONTROL down}), released (e.g. {shift up}), or pressed a number of times (e.g. {z 3}). In an escape group, key name and modifier must be separated by a single shift character.
The keys to set the key modifiers (ALT, CTRL, SHIFT) and in particular the shift key depending on their case, even if used in an escape group. If these keys should not modify the shift key state, wrap them into an escape group and add "key" to the character, e.g. "{Rkey}" to press the R key without changing the shift key state.
When invoked on mobile elements, this method only supports the special keys {BACK} and {MENU}.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Adapter.PressKeys(System.String,Ranorex.Duration)
member.summary: Tries to set focus to the adapter and then presses the keys specified by .
member.param: A sequence of characters and escape groups that specify the keys to press.
The key press time.
member.remarks:
Each key is represented by a single character or an escape group. To specify a single keyboard character, use the character itself (e.g. use "aBc" to press the keys A, B+Shift, and C after another). Only the '{' character has a special meaning and needs to be escaped by preceding it with another '{' (specify "{{" to issue a '{' key press).
Escape groups, signaled by braces "{}", may be used to produce a key action with any of the keys specified by the enumeration. "{Z}" means that the 'z' key should be pressed, and "{return}" or "{enter}" that the Return key is to be pressed.
Additionally, in an escape group you can specify a modifier that determines whether the key should be hold down (e.g. {CONTROL down}), released (e.g. {shift up}), or pressed a number of times (e.g. {z 3}). In an escape group, key name and modifier must be separated by a single shift character.
The keys to set the key modifiers (ALT, CTRL, SHIFT) and in particular the shift key depending on their case, even if used in an escape group. If these keys should not modify the shift key state, wrap them into an escape group and add "key" to the character, e.g. "{Rkey}" to press the R key without changing the shift key state.
When invoked on mobile elements, this method only supports the special keys {BACK} and {MENU}.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Adapter.Swipe(Ranorex.Location,Ranorex.Core.Recorder.Touch.GestureDirection,Ranorex.Core.Distance,Ranorex.Duration,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs a 'Swipe' operations that starts at the point of the element specified by location.
member.param: The location where the swipe should start.
The direction of the swipe.
The duration in that the swipe should get performed.
The distance to swipe. For custom rotations the values is not pixel exact and will likely get rounded. The rounding is dependent of the technology the swipe is executed on.

How many steps the swipe shall have. A step is one distinct move event on the target technology. The default is '0', this means the target technology determines how many steps are made by applying custom heuristics. A step count of one will produce the event sequence 1x pointer down, 1x pointer move and 1x pointer up. A step count of two will produce the event sequence 1x pointer down, 2x pointer move and 1x pointer up.
member.exception: When startLocation is null.
Steps is negative.
Distance is negative.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Adapter.DoubleTap(Ranorex.Location)
member.summary: Performs a double tap action on the adapter with the specified location.
member.param: The location to touch at.
member.remarks: If this method is invoked on a local element, will be called internally performing a click with the right mouse button.

members.member:
Begins a multi touch operation on the adapter. Multi touch operations can be used to compose more complex touch gestures. E.g. a swipe from left to right could be composed in the following way:
adapter.TouchStart(Location.Left); adapter.TouchEnd(Location.Right);
Useful multitouch operations always have the form
1 TouchStart
0-N TouchMove
1 TouchEnd
If the multi touch operation doesn't conform to this form the adapter will still try to perform the provided list of operations but it's likely the result will not be of any use for the UI-automation.
X-Coordinate to click within the element rectangle in pixels. If the value is greater than the width of the element the touch will be performed outside the element.
Y-Coordinate to click within the element rectangle in pixels. If the value is greater than the height of the element the touch will be performed outside the element.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Host.ActivateWindowsApp(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Activates the windows app with the specified app user model ID.
member.param: The ID of the app.
The family name of the app.
member.remarks: A timeout of one minute is used (see ).

member.name: M:Ranorex.Host.ActivateWindowsApp(System.String,System.String,Ranorex.Duration)
member.summary: Activates the windows app with the specified app user model ID.
member.param: The ID of the app.
The family name of the app.
A timeout specifying how long the app launcher process needs to stay open after activation of the app (see remarks).
member.remarks:
To automate Windows apps a process needs to be elevated, however, Windows apps can only be activated from a non-elevated process. Therefore, This methods starts a new non-elevated process that activates the Windows app.
For some applications, the activation process needs to stay alive until the activated app is fully loaded. The argument determines how long the activation process should stay alive after activating the Windows app.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Host.ActivateWindowsApp(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Activates the windows app with the specified app user model ID and arguments.
member.param: The ID of the app.
The family name of the app.
Arguments passed to the app on activation. Depending on the implementation of the app, these arguments may only be available when the app is currently not running.
member.remarks:
To automate Windows apps a process needs to be elevated, however, Windows apps can only be activated from a non-elevated process. Therefore, This methods starts a new non-elevated process that activates the Windows app.
A timeout of one minute is used (see ).

member.name: M:Ranorex.Host.RunMobileApp(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Starts an app on a mobile device. This operation only works for devices that were configured trough the Ranorex user interface. This operation also works when the app is running on the device already. In that case the running app will be closed and started again to reset it into the initial state. Only apps that were instrumented by the Ranorex system can be started by Ranorex.
member.param: The name you configured for your device. If no device with that name exists or is not connected (that means Ranorex isn't able to communicate with the corresponding device) the operation will fail.
The app that shall be started. This has to be the unique application identifier. E.g. for android devices such an app identifier looks like 'ranorex.android.DemoGui'.
member.exception: If deviceDisplayName or appName is null or empty.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Host.RunMobileApp(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Starts an app on a mobile device. This operation only works for devices that were configured trough the Ranorex user interface. This operation also works when the app is running on the device already. In that case the running app will either be closed and started again to reset it into the initial state or only brought to the foreground depending on the 'resetInitialState' parameter. Only apps that were instrumented by the Ranorex system can be started by Ranorex.
member.param: The name you configured for your device. If no device with that name exists or is not connected (that means Ranorex isn't able to communicate with the corresponding device) the operation will fail.
The app that shall be started. This has to be the unique application identifier. E.g. for android devices such an app identifier looks like 'ranorex.android.DemoGui'.
Indicates if the app should be restarted on launch or just brought to the foreground in case the app is already running.
member.exception: If deviceDisplayName or appName is null or empty.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Host.InstrumentAndDeployAndroidApp(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,Ranorex.Host.DeploymentModes,Ranorex.Duration)
member.summary: Can be invoked to instrument/deploy an Android app to a configured device.
member.param: The display name of the device on that the app shall be deployed
File path to the android application that shall be instrumented/deployed (*.apk)

If set to true Ranorex will instrument the application prior to deployment. If set to false Ranorex assumes the APK file is instrumented already. The application will simply be deployed to the device. If this parameter is set to false but the *.apk file you try to deploy is not instrumented Ranorex will not be able to communicate with the device correctly.

States how the deployment shall be done. Possible modes are NoDeploy, WiFi and USB. If NoDeploy is passed no deployment will be done (just instrument the APK file). The instrumented file then can be found in [Drive]:\Users\[UserName]\Documents\Ranorex\InstrumentedApk\[APKName]-instrumented.apk. When WiFi is selected the apk file will be deployed over your wireless network (RanorexService needs to be installed). When USB is selected the app will be deployed over USB cable to your connected device (deployment can be done without installed device service; but for automation the service is still required!). When Auto is selected the app will be deployed using the mode that was used to add the device.

After the specified timeout the operation aborts (timeout can happen when no connection can be established, instrumentation fails...). Depending on the size of your app, instrumentation and deployment can take quite some time. Instrumentation and deployment on low spec PCs can take up to about 10 minutes.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Host.InstrumentAndDeployAndroidApp(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,Ranorex.Host.DeploymentModes,Ranorex.Duration,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Can be invoked to instrument/deploy an Android app to a configured device.
member.param: The display name of the device on that the app shall be deployed
File path to the android application that shall be instrumented/deployed (*.apk)

If set to true Ranorex will instrument the application prior to deployment. If set to false Ranorex assumes the APK file is instrumented already. The application will simply be deployed to the device. If this parameter is set to false but the *.apk file you try to deploy is not instrumented Ranorex will not be able to communicate with the device correctly.

States how the deployment shall be done. Possible modes are NoDeploy, WiFi and USB. If NoDeploy is passed no deployment will be done (just instrument the APK file). The instrumented file then can be found in [Drive]:\Users\[UserName]\Documents\Ranorex\InstrumentedApk\[APKName]-instrumented.apk. When WiFi is selected the apk file will be deployed over your wireless network (RanorexService needs to be installed). When Usb is selected the app will be deployed over USB cable to your connected device (deployment can be done without installed device service; but for automation the service is still required!). When Auto is selected the app will be deployed using the mode that was used to add the device.

After the specified timeout the operation aborts (timeout can happen when no connection can be established, instrumentation fails...). Depending on the size of your app, instrumentation and deployment can take quite some time. Instrumentation and deployment on low spec PCs can take up to about 10 minutes.

When set to true more robust image comparison is used to determine resource id's for images. This option decreases startup performance. (See: http://www.ranorex.com/support/user-guide-20/android-testing.html#FullImageComparison)

When set to false no post processing of the UI-Tree takes place. This results in a larger UI-Tree which could be useful for automating 3rd party Android controls. (See: http://www.ranorex.com/support/user-guide-20/android-testing.html#TreeSimplification)

member.name: M:Ranorex.Host.InstrumentAndDeployAndroidApp(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,Ranorex.Host.DeploymentModes,Ranorex.Duration,Ranorex.Core.Remoting.RecordItems.InstrumentApkOptions)
member.summary: Can be invoked to instrument/deploy an Android app to a configured device.
member.param: The display name of the device on that the app shall be deployed
File path to the android application that shall be instrumented/deployed (*.apk)

If set to true Ranorex will instrument the application prior to deployment. If set to false Ranorex assumes the APK file is instrumented already. The application will simply be deployed to the device. If this parameter is set to false but the *.apk file you try to deploy is not instrumented Ranorex will not be able to communicate with the device correctly.

States how the deployment shall be done. Possible modes are NoDeploy, WiFi and USB. If NoDeploy is passed no deployment will be done (just instrument the APK file). The instrumented file then can be found in [Drive]:\Users\[UserName]\Documents\Ranorex\InstrumentedApk\[APKName]-instrumented.apk. When WiFi is selected the apk file will be deployed over your wireless network (RanorexService needs to be installed). When Usb is selected the app will be deployed over USB cable to your connected device (deployment can be done without installed device service; but for automation the service is still required!). When Auto is selected the app will be deployed using the mode that was used to add the device.

Specifies the timeout for each operation in the instrument and deploy process. After the specified timeout the operation aborts (timeout can happen when no connection can be established, instrumentation fails...). Depending on the size of your app, instrumentation and deployment can take quite some time. Instrumentation and deployment on low spec PCs can take up to about 10 minutes.
Advanced instrumentation options. for more information what the specific options are.
member.exception: Will be throw if is null.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Host.CloseApplication(Ranorex.Core.Element,Ranorex.Duration)
member.summary: Closes an application or web page which contains the specified element. If the application does not react to the close request within the specified grace period, the application process is killed.
member.param: The element whose parent application to close.
A grace period before the process is killed (does not apply to mobile apps).
member.returns: Returns true if the application has closed within the grace period, otherwise false.
member.remarks: Setting the grace period to zero causes the application's process not to be killed.
member.exception: If is negative.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Host.CloseApplications(System.String)
member.summary: Closes an application with a given process name.
member.param: The process name of the application to close.

member.summary: Kills the process which contains the specified element.
member.param: The element whose parent application to kill.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Host.KillApplication(System.Int32)
member.summary: Kills a process which the specified process ID.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Host.KillApplications(System.String)
member.summary: Kills all applications with the specified process name.

member.summary: Opens a web page in the specified browser.

member.name: T:Ranorex.Controls.DataConnectorConfigWrapper
member.summary: Wrapper for the data cache and DataConnectorConfig. The DataCache and be accesses without a config control instance. The DataConnectorConfig is lazy created on the first call to ConfigControl. If the config control instance is created the DataCache is accessed through the config control. Disposing the wrapper disposes the config control and/or data cache.

member.name: T:Ranorex.Controls.DataConnectorConfigFactory
member.summary: Factory responsible for creating a DataConnectorConfig for a given DataConnector. You need to register custom DataConnectors here, so that the DataConnectorConfig can be created.

member.name: T:Ranorex.Controls.DataConnectorConfigFactory.CreateDataConnectorConfigDelegate
member.summary: A delegate which creates a UI to configure the DataConnectorConfig. For example () => new SqlConnectorConfig()
member.returns: A UserControl to configure the DataConnector

member.name: T:Ranorex.Controls.DataConnectorConfigFactory.GetTypeNameDelegate
member.summary: A delegate which generates the typename on demand. For example () => typeof(SqlDataConnector).Name
member.returns: Returns the typename

member.name: P:Ranorex.Controls.DataConnectorConfigFactory.RegisteredDataSourceConfigNames
member.summary: List all the previously registered DataSourceConfigs by name.

members.member:
Registers a datasource
The unique name under which you would like to register the dataSource. A delegate creating a DataConnectorConfig for the given dataSource. A delegate returning the name of the type for which the DataConnectorConfig is created.

Creates a previously registered DataConnectorConfig
The unique name for the dataSource you previously registered. A freshly created DataConnectorConfig

member.summary: Creates a new string which is the TypeName previously registered for the dataSourceName
member.returns: The TypeName for the dataSourceName

member.name: T:Ranorex.Controls.DontShowAgainDialog
member.summary: A dialog containing a "Do not show again" checkbox. If checked on close, subsequent calls to the and methods do not show the form but immediately return.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the form.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the form.
member.param: The identifier of the form used to decide whether the dialog is ignored.

member.name: P:Ranorex.Controls.DontShowAgainDialog.Identifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the identifier used to decide whether the dialog is shown or ignored.
member.remarks: If no identifier is set, the type name of the form/dialog is used.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Controls.DontShowAgainDialog.IsIgnored
member.summary: Determines whether this dialog instance is already ignored.
member.returns: True if the dialog is already ignored; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Controls.DontShowAgainDialog.ShowUnlessIgnored(System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window)
member.summary: Shows the form unless it has formerly been ignored by checking the "Do not show again" checkbox.
member.param: The owner of the form.
member.remarks: If the dialog has formerly been ignored, a call to this method returns immediately. Otherwise this method internally calls the method.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Controls.DontShowAgainDialog.ShowOnce(System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window)
member.summary: Shows the form only once (no "Do not show again" checkbox shown).
member.param: The owner of the form.
member.remarks: This method internally checks and hides the "Do not show again" checkbox and then calls .

member.name: M:Ranorex.Controls.DontShowAgainDialog.ShowDialogUnlessIgnored(System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window)
member.summary: Shows the form as a dialog unless it has formerly been ignored by checking the "Do not show again" checkbox.
member.param: The owner of the form.
member.returns: if the dialog has formerly been ignored; otherwise, the result of the call.
member.remarks: If the dialog has formerly been ignored, a call to this method returns immediately. Otherwise this method internally calls the method.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Controls.DontShowAgainDialog.ShowDialogOnce(System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window)
member.summary: Shows the form as a dialog only once (no "Do not show again" checkbox shown).
member.param: The owner of the form.
member.returns: The value returned by the internally called method.
member.remarks: This method internally checks and hides the "Do not show again" checkbox and then calls .

member.name: P:Ranorex.RxAggregateException.InnerExceptionCount
member.summary:
This helper property is used by the DebuggerDisplay.
Note that we don't want to remove this property and change the debugger display to {InnerExceptions.Count} because DebuggerDisplay should be a single property access or parameterless method call, so that the debugger can use a fast path without using the expression evaluator.
See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/x810d419.aspx

member.summary: Returns the that is the root cause of this exception.
member.returns: The root cause exception.

member.name: M:Ranorex.RxAggregateException.Handle(System.Func{System.Exception,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Invokes a handler on each contained by this .
member.param: The predicate to execute for each exception. The predicate accepts as an argument the to be processed and returns a Boolean to indicate whether the exception was handled.
member.remarks: Each invocation of the returns true or false to indicate whether the was handled. After all invocations, if any exceptions went unhandled, all unhandled exceptions will be put into a new which will be thrown. Otherwise, the method simply returns. If any invocations of the throws an exception, it will halt the processing of any more exceptions and immediately propagate the thrown exception as-is.
member.exception: An exception contained by this was not handled.
The argument is null.

member.name: M:Ranorex.RxAggregateException.Flatten
member.summary: Flattens an instances into a single, new instance.
member.returns: A new, flattened .
member.remarks: If any inner exceptions are themselves instances of , this method will recursively flatten all of them. The inner exceptions returned in the new will be the union of all of the inner exceptions from exception tree rooted at the provided instance.

member.name: M:Ranorex.RxAggregateException.ToString
member.summary: Creates and returns a string representation of the current .
member.returns: A string representation of the current exception.

member.name: P:Ranorex.Imaging.FindOptions.Default
member.summary: Gets or set the default options for image find methods.
member.exception: If setting this property to null.
member.remarks: Change the default options by assigning a new instance to this property. Changing a property value on the instance returned by this property won't change the default options, but only the returned instance; i.e. Ranorex.Imaging.FindOptions.Default.Similarity = 0.95; won't change the default value for , but the following line will: Ranorex.Imaging.FindOptions.Default = new Ranorex.Imaging.FindOptions(0.95);

member.name: P:Ranorex.Imaging.FindOptions.BestMatch
member.summary: Gets or set a value specifying if the best (true) or the first (false) match found in a call to should be returned.

member.name: P:Ranorex.Imaging.FindOptions.Clipping
member.summary: Gets or sets a clipping rectangle in the image that defines the region where the search takes place, i.e. not the whole image is searched but only this rectangle inside it.
member.remarks: The clipping rectangle will always be applied to the first argument of a method, i.e. for the method the value of this property is only applied to the image argument.

member.name: P:Ranorex.Imaging.FindOptions.Preprocessing
member.summary: Gets or sets the preprocessing steps that are performed to the image and the feature bitmaps before searching.

member.name: P:Ranorex.Imaging.FindOptions.Similarity
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum similarity that the feature needs to have with the image to be considered a match.
member.remarks: A smaller similarity causes the search to take longer as more pixels need to be processed before a point in the image can be certain to be no match.
member.exception: If the value lies outside the interval 0.0 and 1.0.

member.name: P:Ranorex.Imaging.FindOptions.DownsizeTargetCosts
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines the estimated costs (time) for searching an image. If is set as a preprocessing step, the image and feature bitmaps are tried to be downsized so that the estimated search costs match this value.
member.remarks:
The time to search for an image is proportional to the product of the areas of the image and the feature bitmap. By settings this value and the as a preprocessing step, you can adjust the estimated search time. Note, that a reduced search time generally reduces the size of the downsized images and thus their quality and the similarity of the search matches.
Image and feature will only be downsized to a minimum of 30% of their original size.

member.name: P:Ranorex.Imaging.FindOptions.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout used to search for the specified feature.
member.remarks:
The timeout specifies the time to iteratively search for the specified feature, i.e. when to stop searching anew. The timeout will not abort a search iteration, i.e. if a single search iteration takes 5 seconds and the timeout is set to 8 seconds, the search will return after 10 seconds (after performing two search iterations).
Additionally, the timeout only applies to searches done on elements, not on bitmaps directly, because only then the searched image can be updated.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Imaging.FindOptions.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns a static, very poor performing hash code!
member.returns: A hash code for this instance.
member.remarks: Since instances are not immutable, the only way to satisfy all and requirements is to return a static number for all instances. Consequently, the performance of a hash table storing instances will be very poor (hash table degenerates to list)!

member.name: T:Ranorex.Imaging.BitmapMemoryPressure
member.summary: Adds memory pressure to a bitmap.
member.remarks:
The .NET class does not handle garbage collection very well, because most of the memory needed by such instances are unmanaged. This class provides memory management for instances without the need to dispose each instance.
This is done by adding an object to the property that tracks the unmanaged memory of the bitmap.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Imaging.BitmapMemoryPressure.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizes an instance of this class.
member.remarks: Removes the GC memory pressure added for the associated bitmap.

member.returns: The bitmap with memory pressure added.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Imaging.Processing.Preprocess(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Preprocesses the specified by converting it to a grayscale image, detecting object edges, thresholding, and/or resizing/scaling it.
member.param: An image.
If true and is not already a grayscale image, converts the image to a grayscale image (see ).
If true, tries to detect object edges in the image (see ).
If true, a threshold (128) is applied to the image (see ).
If not equal to 1.0, the width of the image will be scaled using the specified factor (see ).
If not equal to 1.0, the height of the image will be scaled using the specified factor (see ).
member.returns: The preprocessed image.
member.exception: If is null.
If the input is not a grayscale image, needs to be converted to such, and cannot be converted to pixel format (i.e. if it is no color image in a 32 bit format).

member.name: M:Ranorex.Imaging.Processing.Preprocess(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Boolean,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double,System.Drawing.Point@)
member.summary: Preprocesses the specified by converting it to a grayscale image, detecting object edges, thresholding, and/or resizing/scaling it.
member.param: An image.
If true and is not already a grayscale image, converts the image to a grayscale image (see ).

If true, tries to detect object edges in the image (see ). If the image width or height is smaller than 3 pixels, no edge detection will be performed and this parameter will be false when the method returns.
If true, a threshold (128) is applied to the image (see ).
If not equal to 1.0, the width of the image will be scaled using the specified factor (see ).
If not equal to 1.0, the height of the image will be scaled using the specified factor (see ).

When this method returns, contains a point that specifies the number of pixels the image has been cropped. Cropping takes place to remove a margin that comes from applying an edge detection filter on the image.
member.returns: The preprocessed image.
member.exception: If is null.
If the input is not a grayscale image, needs to be converted to such, and cannot be converted to pixel format (i.e. if it is no color image in a 32 bit format).

If true, a threshold (128) is applied to the image (see ).

Format String Description and Associated Properties

ms Millisecond format.

h Hour format.
d Day format.

If you use capital letters for the string format, the precision of the returned string representation is extended by three decimal digits.

member.name: P:Ranorex.Keyboard.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether physical keyboard actions are enabled.
member.remarks: If the keyboard is disabled, physical keyboard actions will be ignored, i.e. they are not passed on to the system. However, the events (like ) will still be raised with the property of the event arguments set to true. To re-enable specific keyboard events, set the of the event arguments to false.

member.name: P:Ranorex.Keyboard.CharacterMappingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value whether Unicode characters are tried to be mapped to virtual keyboard inputs.
member.value: True to enable Unicode character mapping, false to disable. Default is true.
member.remarks:
If this property is true, in the keyboard methods that take Unicode characters as input the Unicode characters are tried to be mapped to virtual keyboard inputs instead of being directly send to the system as Unicode character input.
If you are working with multiple input locales at the same time, it is usually better to turn character mapping off, i.e. to set this property to false.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Keyboard.EscapeSequence(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces escape characters in by their escaped representation to be used with the method.
member.param: An unescaped sequence of characters.
member.returns: An escaped sequence of characters.
member.exception: If is a null reference.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Keyboard.Press(System.String,Ranorex.Duration)
member.summary: Presses the keys specified by .
member.param: A sequence of characters and escape groups that specify the keys to press.
The key press time.
member.remarks:
Each key is represented by a single character or an escape group. To specify a single keyboard character, use the character itself (e.g. use "aBc" to press the keys A, B+Shift, and C after another). Only the '{' character has a special meaning and needs to be escaped by preceding it with another '{' (specify "{{" to issue a '{' key press).
Escape groups, signaled by braces "{}", may be used to produce a key action with any of the keys specified by the enumeration. "{Z}" means that the 'z' key should be pressed, and "{return}" or "{enter}" that the Return key is to be pressed.
Additionally, in an escape group you can specify a modifier that determines whether the key should be hold down (e.g. {CONTROL down}), released (e.g. {shift up}), or pressed a number of times (e.g. {z 3}). In an escape group, key name and modifier must be separated by a single shift character.
The keys to set the key modifiers (ALT, CTRL, SHIFT) and in particular the shift key depending on their case, even if used in an escape group. If these keys should not modify the shift key state, wrap them into an escape group and add "key" to the character, e.g. "{Rkey}" to press the R key without changing the shift key state.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Keyboard.Press(System.String)

The keys to set the key modifiers (ALT, CTRL, SHIFT) and in particular the shift key depending on their case, even if used in an escape group. If these keys should not modify the shift key state, wrap them into an escape group and add "key" to the character, e.g. "{Rkey}" to press the R key without changing the shift key state.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Location.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class from its string representation.
member.param: The location string. Supports various different formats.
member.example:
Examples for location strings:
'1;2' or '1,2' results in a fixed relative location in pixels.
'0.4;0.6' or '.3,.7' results in a location proportional to the elements size.
Use of the names of location presets (e.g. 'center') is also permitted.
member.returns: The new instance.
member.exception: If the string representation is not valid.

'1;2' or '1,2' results in a fixed relative location in pixels.
'0.4;0.6' or '.3,.7' results in a location proportional to the elements size.

member.returns: True if the conversion was successful, otherwise false.

member.name: T:Ranorex.PopupWatcher
member.summary:
Allows watching for unexpected dialogs and popups in the background.
Use or to register for notifications by providing a repository item or RxPath to watch for, as well as a callback to get notified or another repository item to click on if the watched element is found.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.value: true if report messages should be enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Ranorex.PopupWatcher.RestoreActiveWindow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the active window should be restored after performing the callback/click action.
member.value: true if the previously active window should be restored; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Ranorex.PopupWatcher.ReportCategory
member.summary: Gets or sets the report category used by the watcher to report messages.
member.value: The report category. Defaults to 'Popup Watcher'.

member.name: P:Ranorex.PopupWatcher.UpdateInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the update interval used to search for popup windows in the background.

members.member:
Begins a multi touch operation on the adapter. Multi touch operations can be used to compose more complex touch gestures. E.g. a swipe from left to right could be composed in the following way:
adapter.TouchStart(Location.Left); adapter.TouchEnd(Location.Right);
Useful multitouch operations always have the form
1 TouchStart
0-N TouchMove
1 TouchEnd
If the multi touch operation doesn't conform to this form the adapter will still try to perform the provided list of operations but it's likely the result will not be of any use for the UI-automation.
X-Coordinate to click within the element rectangle in pixels. If the value is greater than the width of the element the touch will be performed outside the element.
Y-Coordinate to click within the element rectangle in pixels. If the value is greater than the height of the element the touch will be performed outside the element.
The element to perform the Touch action on.

Y-Coordinate to click within the element rectangle as percentage (1.0 = 100%). If the value is greater than 1.0 the click will be performed the element.

The pointer identifier to use, with zero being the default pointer.
The timespan between the first and the second position update of the event.

member.summary: Resets the current touch state, removing all active pointers.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Touch.Swipe(Ranorex.Core.Element,Ranorex.Location,Ranorex.Core.Recorder.Touch.GestureDirection,Ranorex.Duration,Ranorex.Core.Distance,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs a 'Swipe' operations that starts at the point of the element specified by location.
member.param: The element based on the swipe should start.
The location where the swipe should start.
The direction of the swipe.
The duration in that the swipe shall get performed.
The distance to swipe. For custom rotations the values is not pixel exact and will likely get rounded. The rounding is dependent of the technology the swipe is executed on.

How many steps the swipe shall have. A step is one distinct move event on the target technology. The default is '0', this means the target technology determines how many steps are made by applying custom heuristics. A step count of one will produce the event sequence 1x pointer down, 1x pointer move and 1x pointer up. A step count of two will produce the event sequence 1x pointer down, 2x pointer move and 1x pointer up.

member.name: M:Ranorex.Report.CopyToFileOrFileStream(System.String,System.String,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Copies a XML or zipped XML report file and all the external files referenced by the report file to a file or stream. This method automatically handles copying from and to zipped and unzipped report files.
member.remarks: Make sure the report is saved first to copy all files. Only currently existing files are copied.
member.param: Full path to the source report file.
Full path to copy the report file to.
The file stream to write to or null.

The following string values are valid for :
Format String Description and Associated Properties
g General format. Returns the of the report level.
h Human readable format. "g" format is used if this instance is one of the ; otherwise "r" format is used.
r Round-trip (serialization) format. Returns a string representation containing all the information to create the instance again using the method.
d Decimal format. Returns the in decimal form. See for more info.
x Hexadecimal format. Returns the in hexadecimal form. See for more info.

member.name: T:Ranorex.Validate
member.summary: Provides a number of different validation methods.
member.remarks:
You can use the following variables in messages you pass to the methods that are replaced by the following values depending on the result of the validation:
Variable Value if validation succeeds Value if the validation fails
"@ValidateRESULT@" "succeeded" "failed"
"@ValidateNOT@" "" "not "
"@ValidateTRUENOT@" "not " ""
For example, the following message will be transformed according to the outcome of the validation:
bool condition = true; Validate.IsTrue(condition, "The validation @ValidateRESULT@.");

member.name: F:Ranorex.Validate.DefaultMessage
member.summary: Use the value of this property to specify that the default validation message should be used.
